Text processsing API¶

Here the text processsing API functions:

matching_analyzer¶

golismero.api.text.matching_analyzer.get_matching_level(text1, text2)¶

Compare two text and return a value between 0-1 with the level of difference. 0 is lowest and 1 the highest.

  • If text1 is more similar to text2, value will be near to 100.
  • If text1 is more different to text2, value will be near to 0.
Parameters:
  • text1 (str) – First text to compare.
  • text2 (str) – Text to comarpe text1.
Returns:

float - Value between 0-1
class golismero.api.text.matching_analyzer.MatchingAnalyzer(base_text, matching_level=0.52, deviation=1.15)¶

Text analyzer and comparer texts.

Compare an undetermined number of text from a base text and generates an iterator with those that are sufficiently different.

append(text, **kargs)¶

If the matching level is accepted store it and the others params in **kargs.

Parameters:
  • text (str) – text to compare.
  • **kargs (special param.) – undefined numbre of params.
Returns:

True if text is accepted. False otherwise.
Retype :

bool
base_text¶

Base text for compare rest of strings

level_average¶

Average of maching level.

Return type:float
unique_texts¶

Return an iterable with unique text.

golismero.api.text.matching_analyzer.HTTP_response_headers_comparer(response_header_1, response_header_2)¶

Does a HTTP comparison to determinate if two HTTP response matches with the same content without need the body content. To do that, remove some HTTP headers (like Date or Cache info).

Return a value between 0-1 with the level of difference. 0 is lowest and 1 the highest.

  • If response_header_1 is more similar to response_header_2, value will be near to 100.
  • If response_header_1 is more different to response_header_2, value will be near to 0.
Parameters:
  • response_header_1 (str) – text with http response headers.
  • response_header_2 (str) – text with http response headers.

Text utils¶

golismero.api.text.text_utils.generate_random_string(string_length=30)¶

Generates a random string with length as parameter.

The key space used to generate random strings are:

  • All ASCII letters (lowercase and uppercase letters).
  • Digits from 0-9.
>>> from golismero.text.text_utils import generate_random_string
>>> generate_random_string(10)
Asi91Ujsn5
>>> generate_random_string(30)
8KNLs981jc0h1ls8b2ks01bc7slgu2
Parameters:string_length (int) – length of string generated
golismero.api.text.text_utils.split_first(s, delims)¶

This function was borrowed from the urllib3 project.

Given a string and an iterable of delimiters, split on the first found delimiter. Return two split parts and the matched delimiter.

If not found, then the first part is the full input string.

Example:

>>> split_first('foo/bar?baz', '?/=')
('foo', 'bar?baz', '/')
>>> split_first('foo/bar?baz', '123')
('foo/bar?baz', '', None)

Scales linearly with number of delims. Not ideal for large number of delims.

Wordlist utils¶

golismero.api.text.text_utils.generate_random_string(string_length=30)

Generates a random string with length as parameter.

The key space used to generate random strings are:

  • All ASCII letters (lowercase and uppercase letters).
  • Digits from 0-9.
>>> from golismero.text.text_utils import generate_random_string
>>> generate_random_string(10)

>>> generate_random_string(30)
8KNLs981jc0h1ls8b2ks01bc7slgu2
Parameters:string_length (int) – length of string generated
golismero.api.text.text_utils.split_first(s, delims)

This function was borrowed from the urllib3 project.

Given a string and an iterable of delimiters, split on the first found delimiter. Return two split parts and the matched delimiter.

If not found, then the first part is the full input string.

Example:

>>> split_first('foo/bar?baz', '?/=')
('foo', 'bar?baz', '/')
>>> split_first('foo/bar?baz', '123')
('foo/bar?baz', '', None)

Scales linearly with number of delims. Not ideal for large number of delims.
